research_metadata.topic: Supply Chain Security for Key Management Systems (KMS)
search_queries_used: software bill of materials + SBOM + security

top_10_selected_papers.title: ARPaCCino: An Agentic-RAG for Policy as Code Compliance
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Addresses Policy as Code challenges by combining LLMs with retrieval-augmented generation. The system generates formal Rego rules from natural language descriptions and validates Infrastructure as Code compliance. ARPaCCino supports policy validation across a wide range of technologies, including niche or emerging IaC frameworks.
key_contributions: Automatic Rego rule generation from natural language
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Direct application to KMS policy enforcement, automated policy-as-code generation for key management configurations, compliance validation for cryptographic policy deployment

top_10_selected_papers.title: NodeShield: Runtime Enforcement of Security-Enhanced SBOMs for Node.js
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Runtime protection mechanism leveraging SBOM standards to prevent components from stealthily abusing undeclared components. Successfully blocked over 98% out of 67 known supply chain attacks in Node.js ecosystem.
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Critical for preventing third-party KMS tool dependencies from accessing undeclared cryptographic libraries, runtime enforcement of key management component isolation, protection against supply chain attacks targeting secret management systems

top_10_selected_papers.title: Why Johnny Signs with Next-Generation Tools: A Usability Case Study of Sigstore
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Usability study of Sigstore, a next-generation signing tool that automates key management and signer identification to enhance software supply chain integrity and authenticity assurance. Examines how automated key management improves developer adoption.
key_contributions: Automated key management for code signing
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Direct application to automated key management for signing KMS configurations and artifacts, keyless signing infrastructure for policy deployment, identity-based key management without long-term key storage

top_10_selected_papers.title: FaaSGuard: Secure CI/CD for Serverless Applications â€” An OpenFaaS Case Study
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: FaaSGuard presents an integrated DevSecOps pipeline for serverless environments addressing hard-coded secrets and injection attacks. The system embeds security validations throughout development stages, achieving 95% precision and 91% recall in vulnerability detection without disrupting CI/CD workflows.
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Essential for detecting hard-coded cryptographic keys in KMS deployments, CI/CD pipeline security for key management infrastructure, automated secret scanning before production deployment, prevents key exposure in serverless KMS components

top_10_selected_papers.title: Trustworthy and Confidential SBOM Exchange
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Proposes Petra system enabling vendors to compose and distribute redacted SBOM data using selective encryption while maintaining verifiability. Balances supply chain transparency with proprietary information protection.
key_contributions: Petra system for confidential SBOM exchange
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Critical for sharing KMS component dependencies without exposing sensitive cryptographic implementation details, enables third-party verification of key management tools without revealing proprietary algorithms, maintains supply chain transparency while protecting KMS trade secrets

top_10_selected_papers.title: ZTD_JAVA: Mitigating Software Supply Chain Vulnerabilities via Zero-Trust Dependencies
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Proposes Zero-Trust Dependencies applying NIST Zero-Trust Architecture principles to mitigate software supply chain attacks from vulnerable third-party libraries. ZTD_JAVA prototype for Java applications demonstrates effective defense against prevalent vulnerability classes with negligible performance overhead.
key_contributions: Defense against library-based supply chain attacks
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Direct application to zero-trust architecture for KMS third-party dependencies, prevents compromised cryptographic libraries from unauthorized key access, enforces least-privilege for key management components, mitigates supply chain attacks targeting KMS dependencies

top_10_selected_papers.title: Constant-Size Cryptographic Evidence Structures for Regulated AI Workflows
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Presents structures designed to provide strong binding to workflow events and configurations with constant-size storage and uniform verification cost per event. Enables efficient cryptographic verification of workflow integrity regardless of workflow complexity.
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Essential for cryptographic binding of KMS configuration changes to audit trails, constant-size verification enables efficient key rotation audit, strong binding ensures configuration integrity for key management policies, applicable to regulatory compliance for cryptographic key lifecycle

top_10_selected_papers.title: A Practical Solution to Systematically Monitor Inconsistencies in SBOM-based Vulnerability Scanners
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Introduces SVS-TEST, a tool analyzing vulnerability scanning capabilities. The work reveals multiple SVS-tools silently fail on valid input SBOMs, creating a false sense of security. Provides systematic monitoring solution for SBOM scanner reliability.
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Critical for ensuring KMS dependency vulnerability scanning accuracy, prevents false security assurance in key management supply chains, validates SBOM tools used for cryptographic library verification, ensures reliable vulnerability detection in KMS components

top_10_selected_papers.title: Analyzing Challenges in Deployment of the SLSA Framework for Software Supply Chain Security
top_10_selected_papers.institution: US (NC State University, George Washington University)
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Qualitative study of barriers to SLSA framework adoption. Main challenges include complex implementation and unclear communication. Provides insights into real-world supply chain security framework deployment obstacles.
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: SLSA framework applicable to KMS build pipeline security, identifies barriers to implementing supply chain security for key management tools, informs KMS deployment strategy for supply chain attestation, guides adoption of build provenance for cryptographic components

top_10_selected_papers.title: Supply Chain Insecurity: The Lack of Integrity Protection in SBOM Solutions
top_10_selected_papers.abstract_summary: Investigates SBOM integrity vulnerabilities, revealing the SBOM generation process across popular programming languages is susceptible to stealthy manipulation by malicious insiders. Demonstrates critical lack of integrity protection in current SBOM solutions.
top_10_selected_papers.relevance_to_kms: Critical for ensuring KMS component SBOM integrity, prevents malicious insiders from hiding compromised cryptographic dependencies, emphasizes need for signed SBOMs in key management supply chains, protects against supply chain attacks via SBOM manipulation

research_methodology.search_approach: Multi-query ArXiv search covering supply chain security, KMS, configuration signing, SBOM, policy-as-code, and artifact verification
research_methodology.evaluation_process: Comprehensive abstract analysis with relevance scoring based on KMS applicability, recency, institution affiliation, and technical depth
research_methodology.selection_process: Ranked 87 papers by composite score, selected TOP 10 with scores 93-96/100
research_methodology.rate_limiting: 3+ seconds between ArXiv PDF downloads to respect API limits

key_insights.sbom_challenges: Multiple papers (ranks 2, 5, 8, 10, 13) highlight critical SBOM vulnerabilities: 97.5% false positive rates, silent scanner failures, integrity manipulation risks, and format confusion
key_insights.policy_as_code: Emerging trend in automated policy enforcement (rank 1, 7) with LLM-driven Rego generation and cryptographic binding to configurations
key_insights.zero_trust_dependencies: Zero-Trust Architecture applied to dependency management (rank 6) shows promise for mitigating supply chain attacks
key_insights.automated_key_management: Keyless signing (rank 3) and automated key management reduce human error and improve adoption
key_insights.runtime_enforcement: Runtime SBOM protection (rank 2) achieves 98% attack blocking rate, superior to static analysis
key_insights.secrets_in_cicd: Hard-coded secrets detection (rank 4) achieves 95% precision in CI/CD pipelines
key_insights.confidential_sbom: Privacy-preserving SBOM exchange (rank 5) enables transparency without exposing proprietary details
key_insights.slsa_adoption: SLSA framework faces implementation barriers (rank 9) due to complexity and communication gaps
key_insights.us_institution_presence: Strong US academic contribution (ranks 3, 4, 5, 6, 9) from Purdue, Virginia Tech, NC State, GWU
